definition: to make a long distance call

sentences.english: This is the charge for your IDD calls.
They traveled in quest of gold.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲尋找黃金而長途跋涉。

sentences.english: An actor circling the stage suggests a long journey.
sentences.chinese: 而演員繞臺奔走則代表長途跋涉。

sentences.english: Optic fiber is now the preferred transmission medium for long-haul trunks.
sentences.chinese: 光纖已是長途幹線的首選傳輸媒質。

sentences.english: Think of the long trip home.
Ma Xu is a long-distance driver.
Please contact Concierge for details of Long Distance Car Hire.
sentences.chinese: 長途包車價格請向禮賓部查詢。

sentences.english: Intercity bus travel has taken off in the last few years.
sentences.chinese: 長途客車旅行在最近的幾年裏深受歡迎。

sentences.english: After a long walk, he wore a black sweat.
sentences.chinese: 長途跋涉後，他出了一身臭汗。

sentences.english: He went to lie down after a long journey.
sentences.chinese: 在長途旅行以後，他躺上牀休息了。

sentences.english: We are the casual acquaintance of a long railway journey.
sentences.chinese: 我們是在火車長途旅行中偶然結識的朋友。

sentences.english: I'm the first guy to drive long-distance on Mars.
sentences.chinese: 我是第一個在火星上開長途車的人。

sentences.english: Grumeti River is the only source of water on their long and tough journey.
sentences.chinese: 在這艱辛的長途跋涉中，格魯美地河是唯一的水源。

sentences.english: I don't feel up to such a long journey.
sentences.chinese: 我不能勝任這樣的長途旅行。

sentences.english: The refrigerated vehicles are suitaBle for long-distance transport of live aquatic products for sale.
sentences.chinese: 水產保鮮車，適宜長途販運鮮活水產品。

sentences.english: They attributed the damage to the effect of dampness during the long sea voyage .
sentences.chinese: 他們把損失歸咎於長途海運中受潮了。

definition: to pass through a country's territory/transit
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
to take the car, bus, train etc
to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
to travel around/to roam/(mobile telephony) roaming
